## Load libraries





::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code .hidden}
suppressPackageStartupMessages({
  library(tidyverse)
  library(randomForest)
  library(terra)
  library(caret)
  library(patchwork)
  library(sf)
})
```
:::






## Load data





::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code .hidden}
 attribute <- c("elevation", "plan_curvature", "profile_curvature", "saga_wetness_index", "catchment_area", "relative_slope_position", "vertical_distance_channel_network")

data <- read_csv(here::here("./notebooks/forest_terrain_data.csv")) %>%
  select("x", "y", "v_col", any_of(attribute))
```

## Map soil property





::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code .hidden}
temp_rast <- rast(data)
crs(x = temp_rast, warn=FALSE) <- "epsg:26914"

coords <- read_csv(here::here("./notebooks/coords.csv"), show_col_types = FALSE) %>% 
  st_as_sf(coords = c("long", "lat"),  crs = 4326) %>%
  st_transform(crs = 26914)

p1<- ggplot() +
  tidyterra::geom_spatraster(data = temp_rast, aes(fill = v_col)) +
  scale_fill_viridis_c(name = bquote(italic("v*")), breaks = seq(2, 7, 1)) +
  geom_sf(data = filter(coords, site == "Forest")) +
  theme_bw(base_size = 12) +
  theme(axis.title = element_blank(),
        axis.text = element_blank(),
        axis.ticks = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "bottom") +
  scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0,0)) +
  scale_x_continuous(expand = c(0,0)) +
  ggspatial::annotation_scale(location = "bl") +
  ggspatial::annotation_north_arrow(location = "br")

p2 <- ggplot() +
  tidyterra::geom_spatraster(data = temp_rast, aes(fill = elevation)) +
  scale_fill_viridis_c(name = "Elevation (m)", option = "inferno") +
  geom_sf(data = filter(coords, site == "Forest")) +
  theme_bw(base_size = 12) +
  theme(axis.title = element_blank(),
        axis.text = element_blank(),
        axis.ticks = element_blank(),
        legend.position = "bottom") +
  scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0,0)) +
  scale_x_continuous(expand = c(0,0)) +
```

## Resampling data

Resolution from 1m by 1m to 10m by 10m





::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code .hidden}
data <- as.data.frame(resample(rast(data), rast(extent = ext(rast(data)), resolution = 10)))
```
:::






## Create training, validation and testing datasets

60 % of the data in the training data set 20 % of the data in the validation data set 20 % of the data in the testing data set






::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code .hidden}
set.seed(123) # makes it reproducible

temp2 <- data %>%
  mutate(dataset = sample(c("train", "validation", "test"), size = nrow(.), replace = TRUE, prob = c(0.6, 0.2, 0.2)))

train <- temp2 %>% 
  filter(dataset == "train" | dataset == "validation") 

validation <- temp2 %>% 
  filter(dataset == "validation") %>%
  select(-dataset)

test <- temp2 %>% 
  filter(dataset == "test") %>%
  select(-dataset)
```
:::






## Feature selection
vifstep() calculates VIF for all variables, excludes the one with the highest VIF (if it is greater than the threshold), repeat the procedure until no variables with a VIF greater than th remains.





::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code .hidden}
features <- usdm::vifstep(select(filter(train, dataset == "train"), -dataset, -v_col), th = 8)
```

## Tune the training RF model using the validation dataset

Instructions (https://stackoverflow.com/questions/18155482/how-to-specify-a-validation-holdout-set-to-caret) 
This uses the caret package and I included the validation set inside my training set and just define the resampling measures to only use the validation data. This step is to optimize the mtry parameter






::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code .hidden}
tc <- trainControl(method = "cv", number = 1, index = list(Fold1 = which(train$dataset == "train")), savePredictions = T)

set.seed(456)
validate.rf <- train(v_col ~ ., data = select(train, -dataset), method = "rf", trControl = tc)
plot(validate.rf)
```

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](v_col_Forest_RF_regression_files/figure-jats/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png)
:::

```{.r .cell-code .hidden}
my_mtry <- validate.rf$finalModel$mtry
my_mtry
```

```
[1] 7
```


:::
:::






## Validation back test

Uses the validation dataset as the test





::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code .hidden}
set.seed(789)

rf.fit <- randomForest(v_col ~ ., data = select(filter(train, dataset == "train"), -dataset), 
                       ntree = 500, keep.forest = TRUE, importance = TRUE, mtry = my_mtry,
                       ytest = select(filter(train, dataset == "validation"), -dataset)$v_col,
                       xtest = dplyr::select(select(filter(train, dataset == "validation"), -dataset), -v_col))
rf.fit
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

Call:
 randomForest(formula = v_col ~ ., data = select(filter(train,      dataset == "train"), -dataset), ntree = 500, keep.forest = TRUE,      importance = TRUE, mtry = my_mtry, ytest = select(filter(train,          dataset == "validation"), -dataset)$v_col, xtest = dplyr::select(select(filter(train,          dataset == "validation"), -dataset), -v_col)) 
               Type of random forest: regression
                     Number of trees: 500
No. of variables tried at each split: 7

          Mean of squared residuals: 0.2094445
                    % Var explained: 59.98
                       Test set MSE: 0.2
                    % Var explained: 62.73
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code .hidden}
oob_val <- sqrt(rf.fit$mse)
test_val <- sqrt(rf.fit$test$mse)

val_plot <- tibble(`Out of Bag Error` = oob_val,
                   Validation = test_val,
                   ntrees = 1:rf.fit$ntree) %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = -ntrees, names_to = "Metric", values_to = "RMSE" )

ggplot(data = val_plot, aes(ntrees, RMSE, color = Metric)) +
  geom_line() +
  theme_bw() +
  xlab("Number of trees")
```

![](v_col_Forest_RF_regression_files/figure-jats/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png)

## Testing the RF model

Uses the RF model to predict the test dataset. We compare predicted against actual





::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code .hidden}
prediction <- predict(rf.fit, newdata = test)
test_plot <- data.frame(pred = prediction, obs = test$v_col)

summary(lm(pred~obs, data = test_plot))
```
